records.location_details: A migrant boat was detected in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), 77 miles from Khoms, Libya. The incident involved NGO speedboats and the Libyan Coast Guard.
records.where_clear: 77 miles offshore Khoms, Libyan Search and Rescue Region

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 2 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Libyan SRR and informed Libyan MRCC and Coast Guard. NGO speedboats were rescuing eleven people when the Libyan Coast Guard (LCG) performed dangerous manoeuvres and fired shots at close range. The Fundamental Rights Office considers this a frequent practice by Libyan authorities, posing risks to fundamental rights. This incident highlights the risks of sending alerts to the Libyan MRCC, leading to disembarkation in a country not considered a place of safety. Previous SIRs also document similar violent interceptions and ill-treatment by LCG.
records.evidence_quote: LCG began a series of dangerous manoeuvres and fired several shots at close range in direction of the speed boats.
